fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28367].
  {panel}

Slash ('/') is not escaped in the Page title when navigated to via WebDAV. Instead, anything past the '/' will be seen as a new directory.

+*Example:*+
Space title is "TEST/SPACE" and key "TS", so its Home Page title is "TEST/SPACE Home". When WebDAV is trying to navigate to it, the directory tree will be seen as: 
/default/Global/TS/TEST/SPACE Home
instead of
/default/Global/TS/TEST\/SPACE Home

(white space doesn't seem to be a problem though)
fields.summary: When / is used in a Page title, WebDAV clients will not interpret it as a character
Restrict Viewing a Page by Version
Application Navigator does not support URLs encoded with some UTF-8

fields.description:
Adding group restrictions in the application navigator in Confluence no longer work.  Old restrictions that were there from previous versions also no longer work.  

!AN-C.png|thumbnail!

Working fine in JIRA - !AN-J.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Application Navigator in Confluence no longer allows you to Restrict To Groups
Property 'scrollTo' of object [object global] is not a function

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28361].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
# Go to the Space Details page of a space (e.g. /spaces/editspace.action?key=FOO)
# Click 'Edit Space Details' link.
# Remove all the text from the 'Home page' option and click 'Save'.

Notice that the 'Home page' option is no longer present on the page. It should show the option with its empty value.

Here is a scenario where this is important. A user:
# accidentally deletes the home page of their space,
# restores the page from the trash,
# notices that going to /display/FOO gives an error about no home page being set and goes looking for the option, and
# cannot find the option because it's not shown anywhere in the Space Tools section.
fields.summary: "Home page" option not shown on Space Details page when value is empty

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28360].
  {panel}

Currently we have no way to hook into the [Macro Property Panel|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Extending+the+Macro+Property+Panel] creation which is based on the macro descriptor.

{code}
    <xhtml-macro key="status" name="status"
                 class="com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.status.StatusMacro"
                 icon="/download/resources/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.status-macro/images/status-icon.png">
        ...
        <property-panel>
            <spacer/>
            <button id="subtle" label="Subtle"/>
            <spacer/>
            <button id="Grey" label=""/>
            <button id="Red" label=""/>
            <button id="Yellow" label=""/>
            <button id="Green" label=""/>
            <button id="Blue" label=""/>
            <button id="Brown" label=""/>
            <spacer/>
        </property-panel>
    </xhtml-macro>
{code}

A use case would be to be able to add additional CSS classes for a button in order to steer its visual appearance, e.g. the _selected_ class. Since we require to wire up the code via JS anyway, the easiest way would be to allow the registration of callbacks able to modify the buttons before they get attached to the DOM. This is an easier to implement and flexible approach than changing the descriptor to allow additional CSS classes on the property-panel elements, as this would be static by default and I'd assume that for the majority of use cases you'd need to assert a state at runtime.
fields.summary: As a plugin developer, I want to be able to modify the generated property panel after creation

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Find/Create a space that has restricted view access
# Create a page and assign a task to a user that doesn't have view access to the page. Save the page.
** User does not receive an email, and the task does not show up in the user's to-do (correct behavior)
# Edit the page and re-assign the task to another user that does have view access to the page. Save the page
** User receives the following email (incorrect behavior)
{noformat}
[name] has updated your tasks in [page-name]
------
[name] has updated the tasks:
[page-name]
Unassigned from you:
* [x][new-assignee-name] [task-description]
{noformat}

I'll mark this as critical since it does present a pretty big security/privacy risk (e.g. you accidentally assign a sensitive task to the wrong person and they receive an email about it when you re-assign it)
fields.summary: User receives an email even though they don't have access to the page where a task was unassigned

fields.description:
*Original report*
observed in Firefox at least.
When I insert something (a macro or an image or an emoticon etc)in the Editor, rather often the editor positions itself to the wrong place. Sometimes even to the top.
Very annoying on long pages.
It also happens when I try to copy some text by moving the mouse over. The highlighted text is no longer highlighed, and the curser jumps to some other place, usually at the top of the editor buffer.

*How to reproduce?*
Create a page with enough content so that the editor will have the vertical scrollbar present. Scroll down to the ~middle of the page and in a new line  add a panel macro. The editor will jump and the newly inserted panel macro will be at the very bottom of the editor.

Tested the behavior with Firefox 19 under Windows and Linux.
fields.summary: Editor: cursor jumps to wrong place after inserting macros
Can't view example code in confluence
Non-ASCII characters in page titles break the Word export feature

fields.description:
Steps:
# Upload file "my.css"
# Edit Properties
# Set New ContentType to "text/css"
# Upload new version of "my.css"

At the last step confluence seems to overwrite the content type set in step 3, since it is a new version of the file, and having set the files content type manually would indicate that confluence was not able to automatically detect the correct and/or desired content type, I think that Confluence should leave this property alone instead of overwriting it.

(This is seen by using Drag-n-Drop to upload, I have not tested if the same issue exists in other cases)
fields.summary: Uploading a new version of an attachment should not overwrite custom contenttype settings

fields.description:
*Background information:* We have a "mixed" Confluence install: most spaces are private to the company but some of them are available to the public. As such, we have set the permissions for these specific spaces to allow anonymous access.

Avatars are hidden by Confluence in these situations (with and without "View User Profiles" enabled for anonymous users under the Global Permissions), which is perfect.

*Problem:* when viewing a space as an anonymous user, Confluence links to /download/attachments/123456/abc under, for instance, "Recent space activity". The HTTP request then gets redirected to the login page, which results in a broken image. The dashboard page, however, correctly shows the placeholder avatar and does not try to embed the user avatar.
fields.summary: Avatars broken with anonymous access

fields.description:
h4. Symptoms

When using the documentation theme, if the share button has been clicked, the drop-down scrolls together with the page. With the default theme this does not happen, the share drop-down stays together with the share button.

This wouldn't be too much of a problem by itself, but it becomes an issue when sharing the page with enough users that you would ordinarily need to scroll past the bottom of the share drop-down to add more.

h4. Steps to Reproduce

# Create or change a space to use documentation theme
# Create or find a page that is long enough to scroll
# Click on the Share button on that page
# Scroll down
# Observe the dialog follows the page and separates from the share button

h4. Workaround

Do the page share in multiple batches, each including a sub-set of all users who need the page shared to them.
fields.summary: Share drop-down separates from Share button when scrolling down using documentation theme, preventing sharing with more users than fit in one screen

fields.description:
h3. Affected buttons
# Login button
# Next button in Create dialog
# Save button in the Editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom colour scheme that changes the colours of the Create button in Confluence
# Log out
# View one of the affected buttons, and observe that it is still the default colours.
#- This should match the colour scheme that is applied to the Create button.
fields.summary: Some buttons do not adhere to the colour scheme

fields.description:
h4. Symptoms When using storePage from the remote API, there are sometimes element attributes which can get stripped. This causes a problem when the client expects the data to be identical once saved, because then the same page being written again will create multiple versions, where it should be ignored due to being identical. What I would expect to happen is that if there is some data which shouldn't be stored in the database, then the "storePage" call should fail, otherwise it should always store exactly what it is given. h4. Steps to Reproduce # Use storePage to create a page with the content: {code:xml}
  • one
  • atwo
{code} # Observe from the return value that the type attribute has been stripped from the element # Update using storePage, and the content originally used # Observe that the page has a new version, and it has the same contents as the old version. Though the 'type="square"' format is not documented in our [Confluence Storage Format|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Storage+Format#ConfluenceStorageFormat-Lists] documentation, it's being created when converting wiki markup to storage format, for example: {code:none} >>> markup = server.confluence2.convertWikiToStorageFormat(token, "- one\n-two") >>> markup '
    \n\t
  • one
    \n-two
    • \n
\n' {code}
fields.summary: Remote API storePage can strip some markup from input in final stored data

fields.description:
h4. Symptoms

When opening up the Confluence Administration Console, the initial screen is a list of administrator's tasks. One of the tasks here is "View the Atlassian Marketplace" and contains a link. The link on this is broken, pointing to the URL:

{noformat}<base_url>/admin/{0}{noformat}

h4. Steps to Reproduce

# (cog-wheel icon) > Confluence Admin
# If the task was already completed, then click "View all completed tasks"
# Hover the "Atlassian Marketplace" link

h4. Workaround

Go directly to [Atlassian Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com] instead.
fields.summary: "View the Atlassian Marketplace" link on Administrator's Tasks is broken

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28326].
  {panel}

This comes from a post on [Answers.Atlassian.com|https://answers.atlassian.com/] which I believe would be a valid feature.

[Is there a way to disable notifications in a space?|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/143231/is-there-a-way-to-disable-notifications-in-a-space?page=1#143633]

The use case would be that a company has multiple spaces but has a specific space which contains sensitive information that they would not like to have traveling over the internet via email.  However, they would still like to be able to have this ability available for spaces which do not contain sensitive information.  So the idea would be say an option in the space admin screens (say a check box) that when checked stops all emails related to that space from being created.

*workaround in the meantime*
Add a filter at the mail server level which blocks emails which contain links to the space in question.  For example 'http://localhost:8090/display/TEST' so they are still created by Confluence but never actually get sent.
fields.summary: Block emails/notifications from a specific space

fields.description: The title says it all. If you use the Google Doc list macro and try search for your docs you are limited to 100 docs (10 pages). This is a big problem for us as we cannot add older documentation to Confluence. This was one of the reasons we purchased it.

Get the discussions going in Confluence

fields.description:
h4. Problem Description
If you put short message on Welcome message in Confluence 5.0, it will lead to broken dashboard on the right tabs in Confluence default dashboard. The character limit can be varied, depends on the styling of the text itself. For more information please refer to the following screenshot.

*Normal Dashboard*
!normal-dashboard.png!

*Broken Dashboard*
!broken-dashboard.png!

h4. Steps to replicate
# Startup Confluence 5.0
# Click the gear icon and navigate to _Confluence Admin >> Global Templates_
# Edit _Default Welcome Message_ to simply *Confluence* and save it
# Go back to Confluence Dashboard

h4. Workaround
You could add the following stylesheet from _Confluence Admin >> Stylesheets_
{code}
.dashboard-section  
{ width: 100%; display: table; }  
.dashboard-group.left  
{ padding: 20px; width:35%; }  
.dashboard-group.right  
{ width:65%; }  
{code}
fields.summary: Broken Dashboard on short Welcome Message

fields.description:
1. Install plugin: Confluence-5.0.1-language-pack-pl_PL.jar (https://translations.atlassian.com)
2. Change language to Polish(Zmieniamy język na polski).
3. Go to spaces, chose Space.
4. Browse -> Space Admin (Przeglądaj -> Administrator przestrzeni).
5. When you chose Application Links(Powiązania aplikacji) you will get System Error(stack trace in attachement).
fields.summary: Getting System Error page when accessing Application Links page - Polish Language

fields.description:
As seen on the screenshot below, Confluence 5.x welcome content does not work properly when using the bundled German language pack:

!german_encoding_problem.png!

All encoding settings are correct and umlaut characters display correctly in an later-entered content.

As one of our customers pointed out, the problem is having {{\UFFD}} string in the place of "ö" and "ü" characters. Normallz these should be:
{noformat}\u00f6 ö
\u00fc ü{noformat}

The problem is described on the following wiki page: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Specials_(Unicode_block)#Replacement_character]
fields.summary: Welcome content in German with wrong character encoding

fields.description:
# Create a page containing an html/xml code block containing the following content:
{code}
<settings xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/SETTINGS/1.0.0"
  xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
  xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/SETTINGS/1.0.0
                      http://maven.apache.org/xsd/settings-1.0.0.xsd">
</settings>
{code}
# Save the page
# Double click on the code block, copy the contents into the clipboard.
# Paste the clipboard into an editor (I use textpad) and save to ~/.m2/settings.xml.
# Run any Maven command, causing it to use settings.xml. Maven will complain:

{code}
[FATAL] Non-parseable settings C:\.m2\settings.xml: start tag unexpected character \ua0 (position: START_DOCUMENT seen <settings xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/SETTINGS/1.0.0"\r\n\ua0... @2:2)  @ C:\.m2\settings.xml, line 2, column 2
{code}

It seems that Confluence is inserting unicode characters into the clipboard (at the end of each line) which causes Maven to fail.

Expected behavior: The clipboard should contain the exact same characters that were put into the code block in the first place.

Workaround: Edit page, copy contents of code block into clipboard. Contents are now correct.

I am setting priority to critical because this issue results in data loss/corruption for the typical use-case.

*Workaround:*

As the No Format macro doesn't allow for double click selection, one potential solution is to disable the Code Macro (by going to Confluence Admin > Manage Add-ons > System Add-ons) and then create a user macro called something like 'code' with the template: <ac:macro ac:name="noformat"><ac:plain-text-body><![CDATA[ $body]]></ac:plain-text-body></ac:macro>, which means that whenever someone goes to create a code macro, they instead make a No Format macro.
fields.summary: Unexpected unicode characters inserted into code block

fields.description:
We have some pages in sample space whith contain multi-byte(DBCS) string.  
When using "Search Result Macro" of Confluence 4.3.7 with multi-byte(DBCS) string as "search terms", it failed to search for pages, so no pages are matching. (please see result01.jpg-03.jpg)

But when using SBCS string as "search terms",  Search Result Macro displays target page as expected. (see result04.jpg)

It seems that there are some length limitation but not documented.

I send you SopportZip/Space XML zip/result01-04.zip.

Thank you in advance,
Chihara
fields.summary: Result Search Macro can't function, if target comtains multi-byte/DBCS characters

fields.description:

When clicking the favorite button to the right of space names on the dashboard, it doesn't always work. The first time it happened, I would click the button on an un-favorite space, see a flash of the spinning circle icon for about 1 second, and then the star would go back to being un-selected.

It took several refreshes of the dashboard in order for the favorite button to work to 'favourite/star' a space on the dashboard.

fields.description:

When I was updating (team calendars), the downloading...installing.. progress screen came up. However, about every 10 or 15 seconds the Administrator Access page kept coming up, asking me to enter my admin password.
fields.summary: need to keep re-authenticating as an admin when updating plugins in Confluence 5.0.1

fields.description: {panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28313]. {panel} Sometimes macros are reasonably simple in terms of what they output, e.g. the [Status Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Status+Macro]. In order to approximate to [WYSIWYG|http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/WYSIWYG], the only choice these macros currently have is to use the [EditorImagePlaceholder|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Providing+an+Image+as+a+Macro+Placeholder+in+the+Editor] in order to create an image of the rendered output. This is suboptimal for several reasons: * Browsers render HTML/CSS slightly differently, the image output will always be just an approximation * There are no good JVM-based HTML/CSS render engines out there, the best bet would be to either use [Flying Saucer|http://code.google.com/p/flying-saucer/] (only supports CSS 2.1) or to ship with one of the Browser's rendering engines (e.g. WebKit wrapped in QtWebKit via [Qt-Jambi |http://qt-jambi.org/] Any solution using this approach will be unnecessarily complex when the goal is to just use the output of the macro in the editor. There is also a CustomHtmlEditorPlaceholder interface available, but the implementation is also restricted to img and object tags. I've identified the following reasons for why the editor applies these restrictions so far: * the custom HTML should not be editable, as it gives the user the impression that whatever he puts inside the placeholder will be persisted for the page, but that code is just "thrown away" * images are single elements without a text node, thus the cursor never jumps in, and drag&drop is easy to implement As for the first restriction, imo that should be a decision made by the plugin developer. One possible implementation I envision for this is to utilize TinyMCE's [noneditable|http://www.tinymce.com/tryit/noneditable_content.php] to signalise the user that the content is not editable. Also this plugin has its quirks, if the user somehow gets into the placeholder and starts editing the only effect is that this edit gets lost. If that happens often we can iterate on making the plugin better or even add supplying JS signalising the user that he's in the wrong spot. As for the second restriction, it is easy to identify the placeholders root element as it contains all the attributes a normal macro contains in the editor (e.g. data-macro-name), thus Drag&Drop should be relatively easy to implement for that. I'd suggest modifying the CustomPlaceholderEditorMarshaller to allow custom HTML beyond and
fields.summary: As a plugin developer, I want to render the output of my macro in the editor

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28312].
  {panel}

We currently need configurations like 

{code}
    <web-resource key="page-editor-js" name="Confluence Page Editor Javascript resources only" i18n-name-key="admin.web.resources.plugin.js.page.editor.name">
...
        <transformation extension="soy">
            <transformer key="soyTransformer"><functions>com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.soy:soy-core-functions</functions></transformer>
        </transformation>
...
        <resource type="download" name="image-dialog-soy.js" location="/includes/soy/image-dialog.soy">
            <param name="source" value="webContextStatic"/>
        </resource>
...
    </web-resource>
{code}

or

{code}
    <web-resource name="Status Resources" key="editor_status">
        <transformation extension="less">
            <transformer key="less-transformer"/>
        </transformation>
...
        <resource type="download" name="status.css" location="css/status.less"/>
    </web-resource>
{code}

even though it's obvious that you need a Soy or LESS transformer based on the extension. 

I'd suggest implementing a global transformation registry to be used by a decorated WebResourceModuleDescriptor in order to append to the list returned from  getTransformations. This implementation should filter duplicates and issue a warning (in dev mode) if the descriptor contains transformations which are already covered by the global registry, encouraging the plugin developer to remove those (unless backwards-compatibility has to be maintained). The global registry should only contain transformations which are operate on their distinctive file extensions (e.g. *.less and *.soy).
fields.summary: As a plugin developer, I want to use transformers like Soy and LESS automagically
Provide a method to import images specified in img tags when importing html from disk

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 06 March 2013|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5|titleBGColor=#3C78B5|titleColor=#FFFFFF|bgColor=#E7F4FA}

This issue has been duplicated by the issue at [CONFSERVER-25880 - Copy and Paste Row that contains Macro Breaks Row Paste| https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-25880]. Please watch that issue for further updates and more detailed workarounds.
{panel}

This could be a duplicate of CONF-25880. This issue is a real pain for us because we use tables with with expands for all sorts of things. 

Steps to recreate: 
1. create a table with a few columns
2. in one of the cells, add an expand
3. use the copy row button on the toolbar
4. create a new row and then click in it
5. use the paste row button. 
6. result: the row is pasted incorrectly (see attached screen cap).
fields.summary: Copying and pasting a row in a confluence table that contains an expand doesn't work properly

fields.description:
h3.Problem
There is no *cancel* button on the attachments popup dialog and errors with the following line:
bq.File of size XX.X MB exceeds maximum upload limit of XX.XX MB

h3.Workaround
You need to hit 'esc' in order to go back to the other window.

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*
# Create any page tree structure, add the [Page Tree Search Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Page+Tree+Search+Macro] somewhere and specify a root page for it.
# Set the [indexing language|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+Indexing+Language] to English, then rebuild content index at *Confluence Admin > Content Indexing*
# Notice that the search macro works as expected, only those pages are returned that are children of the defined root page
# Change the [indexing language|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+Indexing+Language] to *Other*, rebuild the index again
# Notice that you can enter a search term, root page will be ignored

*Workaround*
If possible, use English as the indexing language.
fields.summary: Pagetree Search Macro ignores root page setting if indexing language is Other
Invalid Unicode character \uFFFD in German translations

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28299].
  {panel}

Confluence before version 4.0 did mark external links with a little green arrow to the up-right, and a little green arrow for attached files pointing to the lower-right.

I think this was very helpful when managing pages (links), as it was easy to see at a glance where the link was pointing to, internal page link vs external link vs attachment.

With 4.x, these green arrows are gone. 

I want to request to bring them back. (If you prefer, make it configurable to turn them on or off).

As this feature was gone without any communication, I mark this request as "bug", not "improvement".
fields.summary: Missing green arrows on external links and attachment links

fields.description:
In the setup wizard in Load Content, you will see this sentence under 'Restore from Backup':
{quote}Use data from a previous installation of Confluence. If you are upgrading or replicating Confluence you will probably want to select this option.{quote}

This is incorrect - if you are upgrading Confluence you should never see the setup wizard. If you have reached this point during an upgrade, something has gone wrong.

This sentence should read something more along the lines of:
{quote}Use data from *another* installation of Confluence. If you are *migrating to another database* or replicating Confluence you will probably want to select this option.{quote}

h3. Workaround
Please see the instructions for [Upgrading Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Upgrading+Confluence] for the correct upgrade procedure.
fields.summary: Install Wizard indicates that importing data is a valid step in upgrading. This is not the case.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28297].
  {panel}

With Confluence on Demand it is not possible to have duplicate page names in one specific space. This is due to architectural/programming decisions by atlassian.

In the Marketplace there is an extension from k15t.com which provides the functionality for Confluence Users which install the product on their own server.

So basically it is possible to have duplicate page names as long as the page permalink is unique.

Further details about the extension which does this functionality is to be found here:
http://www.k15t.com/display/en/2012/11/08/Duplicate+Page+Titles+in+Confluence+for+Everyone

REQUEST:
Atlassian should add the possibility to have duplicate page names ASAP as we need to have structure with repeating page names like:

DVD Authoring
  - Overview
  - Authoring
  - Testing

Blu-ray Authoring
  - Overview
  - Authoring
  - Testing

etc.

As the On Demand Confluence product does not allow to install extensions from the marketplace, we are dependent solely on Atlassian to put this feature on the roadmap for future versions for the on demand product.

We think it is important for serious documentation of processes.

Thank you and kind regards

Sandro Barbieri

REDSMOKE PRODUCTIONS GmbH
Grabenstrasse 9
8952 Schlieren
SWITZERLAND

P: 0041 44 575 22 44
fields.summary: Allow Duplicate Page Names in same Space for Confluence on Demand Product

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up a Confluence 4.3.x with a favicon
# Upgrade to 5.0
# Observe that your favicon is gone

h3. Resolution
The favicon.ico is stored in <confluence-install>/confluence. If you upgraded manually, your installation directory will be different and will not contain your customised favicon.ico file. Copy it from the old installation directory to the new, and restart Confluence.

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create an instance with a global logo on 4.3.x
# Upgrade to 5.0 
# Observe that the logo has disappeared and needs to be reuploaded

h3. Response from Product Managers
This is not a bug but rather a naming change that came about during the new header implementation. What Confluence previously called the "global logo" was really just a "default space logo" since it could be overridden on a per-space basis. When the new global header came along, it required us to introduce a true global logo that always appears in the header and doesn't change on a per-space basis. Therefore we renamed "global logo" to "default space logo" and introduced a new, true global "site logo" that's consistent with the other products.

Closing this as 'Not a bug'.
fields.summary: Upon upgrade to 5.0, existing Global Logos are lost

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28275].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 29 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Update: please refer to my [comment|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-28275?focusedCommentId=648705&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-648705] for the latest status on this ticket.
----
Thanks for the continued feedback and completing the survey, which helped us understand your pain points with the current design. The majority (84%) of example logos provided were rectangular in shape, so simply preventing the rounding of space logos (as some requested) would not solve the problem for these 84%. Therefore, we have built a new uploader which works for both square and rectangular logos.

With the current uploader, you can only select a portion of a rectangular logo, e.g.:
!before.png!

With the new uploader, you can zoom out and crop ‘beyond’ the border of the image, allowing you to fit the entire logo in, e.g.: 
!after.png!

This works for a square logo as well, and allows you to adjust it inside the area that was previously clipped due to the circular mask.

These changes will be shipping in Confluence 5.6 and in a Confluence OnDemand update in the next few weeks.

Thanks again to all for your input and feedback, I'll now be marking this issue as closed.

Regards,
John
Confluence Product Manager
{panel}

With Confluence 5.0, rounding of space logos was introduced and enforced as the only option.

Some logos do not lend themselves to rounding and look quite bad with it. There should be a way to set space logos without modification as before.

h5. Workaround

For a workaround involving CSS (as well as background on why rounded logos were introduced), please see [this comment|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-28275?focusedCommentId=450941&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-450941].
fields.summary: Provide a way to avoid the automatic rounding of space logos
Option to include comments for blogpost PDF export

fields.description:
h4. Symptoms

If an XML backup is done from one Confluence instance running on one type of database type, and is then imported into another Confluence instance using a different database type, then chances are the import will fail due to incompatible types.

This appears to be a problem when importing between a database type where booleans are a valid column type, into a database where boolean is not a column type. At this stage it's confirmed to definitely happen when importing an export from PostgreSQL into Oracle.

This is currently happening with the data stored for the Space Sidebar. This will show a the following error message in the browser:

{code:none}
Import failed. Check your server logs for more information. com.atlassian.activeobjects.spi.ActiveObjectsImportExportException: There was an error during import/export with plugin Confluence Space IA (Left Sidebar)(com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-space-ia) #5.0 (table AO_187CCC_SIDEBAR_LINK):There has been a SQL exception importing row #0 for table 'AO_187CCC_SIDEBAR_LINK' see the cause of this exception for more detail about it.
{code}

And the following stack trace in the log file:

{code}
2013-02-26 22:19:53,208 ERROR [Long running task: Importing data] [confluence.importexport.actions.ImportLongRunningTask] runInternal Failure during import
 -- referer: http://localhost/setup/setup-restore-start.action | url: /setup/setup-restore-local.action | userName: anonymous | action: setup-restore-local
com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.ImportExportException: com.atlassian.activeobjects.spi.ActiveObjectsImportExportException: There was an error during import/export with plugin Confluence Space IA (Left Sidebar)(com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-space-ia) #5.0 (table AO_187CCC_SIDEBAR_LINK):There has been a SQL exception importing row #0 for table 'AO_187CCC_SIDEBAR_LINK' see  the cause of this exception for more detail about it.
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.confluence.backup.ActiveObjectsBackupRestoreProvider.restore(ActiveObjectsBackupRestoreProvider.java:62)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.xmlimport.FileBackupImporter.importPluginData(FileBackupImporter.java:367)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.xmlimport.FileBackupImporter.importEverything(FileBackupImporter.java:138)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.xmlimport.BackupImporter$1.doInTransactionWithoutResult(BackupImporter.java:156)
	at org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionCallbackWithoutResult.doInTransaction(TransactionCallbackWithoutResult.java:33)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.xmlimport.RestorePluginStateStoreTransactionCallbackDecorator.doInTransaction(RestorePluginStateStoreTransactionCallbackDecorator.java:47)
	at org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionTemplate.execute(TransactionTemplate.java:128)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.xmlimport.BackupImporter.doImportInternal(BackupImporter.java:149)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.Importer.doImport(Importer.java:75)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.DefaultImportExportManager.performImportInternal(DefaultImportExportManager.java:79)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.DefaultImportExportManager.performImport(DefaultImportExportManager.java:69)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:307)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.invokeJoinpoint(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:182)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:149)
	at org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionInterceptor.invoke(TransactionInterceptor.java:106)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:204)
	at sun.proxy.$Proxy117.performImport(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.actions.ImportLongRunningTask.runInternal(ImportLongRunningTask.java:86)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.util.longrunning.ConfluenceAbstractLongRunningTask.run(ConfluenceAbstractLongRunningTask.java:26)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.util.longrunning.ManagedTask.run(ManagedTask.java:35)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
Caused by: com.atlassian.activeobjects.spi.ActiveObjectsImportExportException: There was an error during import/export with plugin Confluence Space IA (Left Sidebar)(com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-space-ia) #5.0 (table AO_187CCC_SIDEBAR_LINK):There has been a SQL exception importing row #0 for table 'AO_187CCC_SIDEBAR_LINK' see  the cause of this exception for more detail about it.
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ImportExportErrorServiceImpl.newRowImportSqlException(ImportExportErrorServiceImpl.java:36)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.importer.DataImporter.importTable(DataImporter.java:131)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.importer.DataImporter.access$000(DataImporter.java:33)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.importer.DataImporter$1.call(DataImporter.java:73)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.importer.DataImporter$1.call(DataImporter.java:62)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.jdbc.JdbcUtils.withConnection(JdbcUtils.java:31)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.importer.DataImporter.doImportNode(DataImporter.java:61)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.importer.AbstractImporter.importNode(AbstractImporter.java:49)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.DbImporter.importData(DbImporter.java:73)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ActiveObjectsBackup.restore(ActiveObjectsBackup.java:158)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:307)
	at org.springframework.osgi.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceInvoker.doInvoke(ServiceInvoker.java:58)
	at org.springframework.osgi.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceInvoker.invoke(ServiceInvoker.java:62)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.doProceed(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:131)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.invoke(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:119)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
	at org.springframework.osgi.service.util.internal.aop.ServiceTCCLInterceptor.invokeUnprivileged(ServiceTCCLInterceptor.java:56)
	at org.springframework.osgi.service.util.internal.aop.ServiceTCCLInterceptor.invoke(ServiceTCCLInterceptor.java:39)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
	at org.springframework.osgi.service.importer.support.LocalBundleContextAdvice.invoke(LocalBundleContextAdvice.java:59)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.doProceed(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:131)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.invoke(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:119)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:204)
	at sun.proxy.$Proxy361.restore(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.confluence.backup.ActiveObjectsBackupRestoreProvider.restore(ActiveObjectsBackupRestoreProvider.java:58)
	... 30 more
Caused by: java.sql.SQLException: Invalid column type: 16
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleStatement.getInternalType(OracleStatement.java:3916)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.OraclePreparedStatement.setNullCritical(OraclePreparedStatement.java:4541)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.OraclePreparedStatement.setNull(OraclePreparedStatement.java:4523)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.OraclePreparedStatementWrapper.setNull(OraclePreparedStatementWrapper.java:1281)
	at com.mchange.v2.c3p0.impl.NewProxyPreparedStatement.setNull(NewProxyPreparedStatement.java:157)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.importer.DataImporter$BaseInserter.setBoolean(DataImporter.java:344)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.importer.DataImporter$BaseInserter.setValue(DataImporter.java:413)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.importer.DataImporter.importTable(DataImporter.java:123)
	... 60 more
{code}

h4. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a full system XML backup from Confluence running on PostgreSQL
# Install a new Confluence instance on Oracle, and import the data exported from the PostgreSQL instance

h4. Cause

The data types saved in the activeObjectsBackupRestoreProvide.pdata file are defined exactly by the physical schema of the database. When restoring, Confluence attempts to reconstruct the tables using the column types of the source database.

In the case of Oracle importing from PostgreSQL, this triggers the Hibernate bug [HHH-6759|https://hibernate.atlassian.net/browse/HHH-6759].

h4. Workaround

In the case where there are boolean values causing the issue, you can fix by:

# Unzip the backup file
# Edit plugin-data/com.atlassian.activeobjects.confluence.spi/activeObjectsBackupRestoreProvider.pdata
# Replace any occurrence of {code:xml}<boolean xsi:nil="true"/>{code} with {code:xml}<integer xsi:nil="true"/>{code}
# Re-zip the backup
# Import the new fixed backup

h4. Test notes
# After importing backup created on PGSQL to Oracle, make sure that AO data has been restored from previous instance and that you can add, edit, delete AO data - WD notifications are an example of these.
fields.summary: XML backup of ActiveObjects plugin data is not portable between database types

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28262].
  {panel}

Hi,

as we try to construct a Confluence-based knowledge base to assist our user support we encountered a Stack-Trace quite similar to CONF-19117. The headline's length is caused by the inclusion of appropriate error-messages.

Steps to reproduce:
# From any page choose Tools -> Import Word Document
# Choose and upload a file containing headings of more than 255 character length e.g. [^exception.doc]
# Select the depth at which the overly long headings reside in "Split by heading"
# Hit "Import" and "Continue"
# Great 500-page

Suggestions to prevent this error:
- Immediately after choosing "Split by heading" check the result's title-lengths and prefix any overly long title by (!)
- Offer to change titles in configuration or confirmation step to fulfil requirements
- Change TITLE-column to "TEXT"-type (and maybe soft-limit to 512 or something)

Regards

Matthias
fields.summary: "Split by heading" fails with exception on long headings

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28261].
  {panel}

h5. Steps to reproduce:
# Install Confluence in a machine that has no QuickTime installed
# Attach [^sample_mpeg4.mp4] into Confluence
# Embed it in Confluence page using Multimedia macro
# Set 'Autoplay' On
# Result: The mp4 file does not play

Looks like this is a problem with mp4 files in general, when QuickTime plugin is not installed in the system. This only happens when Confluence hosts the mp4 file. Saving the page to local hard drive (containing the multimedia macro) renders a proper behavior: The mp4 file is played despite not having QuickTime plugin installed. 

Can't figure out what might be causing this as the source code is exactly the same, local vs Confluence, with the exception of where the mp4 file is being played from (in Confluence, it's played from the attachments link, while in the local hard drive, the mp4 file is loaded from the hard drive itself).
fields.summary: mp4 file does not play when QuickTime plugin is not installed
Add progress indicators to all macros when they're updating

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28259].
  {panel}

I was typing on a big screen here on L16 for team meeting...

I used the KB shortcuts to insert row before and after to put some rows in ...

None of them had any idea they existed - they were like "How do you do that?..." 

Told them to look in the KB shortcuts dialog.. then I realised it isn't there!

https://skitch.com/sherif/8m5tf/skitched-20120321-142610

We should add the two shortcuts there - they are awesome, let's make them more discoverable!
fields.summary: Add shortcut for insert row before/after to the KB shortcuts dialog
Add Remote API method to allow removal of historical versions of pages
Allow Confluence users to hide the "getting started" steps

fields.description: An OnDemand customer reported this issue. This is how it looks with the documentation theme. See attached.
fields.summary: Spacing in getting started steps have way too much padding in documentation theme
